Description: I believe this to be an early edition Epiphone sg Gothic in the matte black finish. serial # research indicates it was made in Unsung Plant, Korea, April of 2004, production #2745. all my Korean made guitars, Epi's and especially my fender teles are top quality all the way thru. definately NOT a cheap made piece of crap guitar. it has a Gibson style set neck, grover tuners, rosewood fret board with little if any wear , and the 12th fret inlay XII , and substantial weight for power and sustain. neck is straight and no cracks, repairs, or signs of abuse throughout the guitar, just some normal, minor surface dings,scratches on back of body that are no issue at all, back of neck is ding free and sweet. Gibson style bridge and tailpiece. all hardware is good quality in black finish. double humbuckers for fat sound, new control knobs and an Epi gig bag to sleep in. this is an xlnt entry level or progressing players guitar for anyone that wants a nice instrument at an affordable price. pro set up with new strings, intonation set, and ready to rock. again, NOT JUNK. buyer adds $20 bucks towards shipping, most likely will be twice that, and i'll cover the rest, within the mainland 48 states only, elsewhere can be discussed. i will pack it well. email any ??'s, THNX for looks and bids. keep on rockin'
Title: Epiphone sg Gothic matte black, from 2004  ready to Rock
